intro: Rosa humilis var. plena, commonly known as the double-flowered shrub rose, is a compact, bushy plant native to the Mediterranean region. It produces abundant, full-bodied blooms with multiple layers of petals, giving it a lush, ornamental appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters and features thorny stems and dark green, serrated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for gardens and landscapes. Its flowering period extends from early summer to late autumn, adding continuous color to the garden.
